blog.name: asongofstarkandtargaryen
blog.title: Dracarys!
blog.description: Jon/Dany/Bran/Arya Stan. Salty about the got ending. Also likes: The 100,  Star Wars, Stranger Things.

summary: You are all sleeping on Arya Stark. This girl had one of the best and most meaningful arcs on the story. She’s not only a...
body:
You are all sleeping on Arya Stark.

This girl had one of the best and most meaningful arcs on the story. She’s not only a kickass fighter (that’s the only trait the fandom usually associate her with), she’s also extremely intelligent, very compassionate, loves the small folk and has great leadership abilities. 

Also, she’s a great role model for young girls because she proves that you don’t have to follow the rules the society has set for your gender in order to be an accomplished person. You can always make your own path based on your personal values and skills.  And in the misogynist society we live in (and not to mention the even more misogynist society Arya lives in) where there are certain gender expectations, to do something different is a powerful move and sets a good example for us all.

Furthermore, we could all get some inspiration from Arya’s tremendous inner strength. That little girl grew up as almost royality until she was nine and then she was suddenly thrown into poverty .Her life became upside down in a moment and she had to learn how to survive living in the streets, finding food and defending herself from those who wished her harm. She has been a prisoner, a servant, a refugee and a student in an assassination guild. She has also been mistreated, mocked, abused and has witness some very horrific scenes (one example is watching the maimed dead body of her brother, Robb but there are man others,too). 

Despite all these horrors she endured, she never truly forgot her identity (even when she pretended she did during her stay with the Faceless men). She never gave up, she never stopped being Arya Stark of Winterfell and she never forsake her long lost pack.  She fought tooth and nails to return back to her home and now she made it back she continues to help those who are close to her.

Arya Stark is an incredible character and I sincerely wish there were more literary characters like her.

summary: I’m a huge fan of Pride and Prejudice. And since Arya shares some similarities with Elizabeth in terms of personal traits I...
body:
I’m a huge fan of Pride and Prejudice.

And since Arya shares some similarities with Elizabeth in terms of personal traits I wouldn’t mind to get a scene (in fact I’d love it) where Gendry confesses his feelings while standing in the rain just like it happened in the P&P 2005 film:

summary: But finally he stopped and said, “I think Lommy’s going to die.“She was not surprised. Kurz had died of his wound, and he’d been...
text:
But finally he stopped and said, “I think Lommy’s going to die.“She was not surprised. Kurz had died of his wound, and he’d been a lot stronger than Lommy. Whenever it was Arya’s turn to help carry him, she could feel how warm his skin was, and smell the stink off his leg. "Maybe we could find a maester …”
“You only find maesters in castles, and even if we found one, he wouldn’t dirty his hands on the likes of Lommy.” Gendry ducked under a low-hanging limb.
“That’s not true.” Maester Luwin would have helped anyone who came to him, she was certain.
“He’s going to die, and the sooner he does it, the better for the rest of us. We should just leave him, like he says. If it was you or me hurt, you know he’d leave us.” They scrambled down a steep cut and up the other side, using roots for handholds. “I’m sick of carrying him, and I’m sick of all his talk about yielding too. If he could stand up, I’d knock his teeth in. Lommy’s no use to anyone. That crying girl’s no use either.”
“You leave Weasel alone, she’s just scared and hungry is all.” Arya glanced back, but the girl was not following for once. Hot Pie must have grabbed her, like Gendry had told him.
“She’s no use,” Gendry repeated stubbornly.

body:
a pure heroine

she is powerful

she has been defiled and violated.

ripped from her family

ripped from her home.

but when winter comes, the roses will still grow strong, the lioness will still roar, and we will take what is ours with

fire &

blood

-self written poem. dedicated to the powerful women of the 7 kingdoms. thank you for showing us how powerful women really are.

body:
Arya and Gendry: *are in a car chase, gendry is driving*

Gendry: *stops suddenly*

Arya: Why’d you stop???

Gendry: The light’s red!

Arya: THERE ARE NO RED LIGHTS IN A CAR CHASE!!!!!!!!

Checking it twice
Cause not a single one is gonna survive

To the tune of Santa Claus is Coming to Town:

She’s making a list

Cause not a single one is gonna survive

blog.name: jackoshadows
blog.title: Jak O' the Shadows
blog.description: I’m not going to swear an oath I can’t uphold. Talk about my father if you want. Tell me that’s the attitude that got him killed. But when enough people make false promises, words stop meaning anything. Then there are no more answers - only better and better lies. And lies won’t help us in this fight - Jon Snow.

summary: I really don’t get this Sansa has to protect Jon through marriage nonsense. Like total, absolute horse crap.  There are 7...
body:
I really don’t get this Sansa has to protect Jon through marriage nonsense. Like total, absolute horse crap.

There are 7 kingdoms in Westeros.

- The North: Jon has the support of Lyanna Mormont and some houses - like Alys and Umber will support him. He will also always have the support of house Stark - or atleast of Arya and Bran.

-  The Rock/Lannisters - Enemies of the North/Starks, current rulers in KL. They are not going to be supporting anyone

- Dorne - Allied to Dany, defeated by Euron/Cersei. Current situation unknown. But they have been tradionally Targ allies both in the books and show

- The Riverlands/Iron Islands - Edmure Tully, his wife and child are still alive. The last we saw, they were imprisoned by the Freys. Arya annihilated the Freys and Edmure is possibly free. Edmure owes Arya his freedom and if Arya supports Jon, then so will Edmure. In the books, Edmure is a witness and signatory to Robb’s will which legitimizes and makes Jon KITN and a Stark and at the same time disinherits Sansa. 

  Euron is most likely going to be defeated. Yara and Theon Greyjoy are Dany allies.

 - The Stormlands - on the show, all the Baratheons are gone except for Gendry. Gendry can be legitimized and given the Stormlands by Dany, he is a good Jon friend and there is Arya who supports Jon.

-  The Reach: The Tyrells were Dany allies before they were betrayed and backstabbed by the traitor Tarlys. The Lannisters sacked and looted the Reach. Current status unknown. But I doubt the other houses in the region are happy about what was done to the Tyrells. Will most likely continue to support Dany.

 - The Vale: The only support we know is there for Sansa as opposed to Jon/Dany. Even this support is nebulous and depends on SweetRobin. If SweetRobin makes an alliance elsewhere and marries a Dornish princess, then his allegiance is to Dorne and not to the North.

The others - the Wildlings will support Jon. The Dothraki/unsullied will support Dany, Iron Bank will support the richest candidate, the Citadel are opportunistic idiots, and the small folk don’t have a say in who rules over them.

So this is the current situation. Allying with Dany, gives Jon a lot of political and military power. So why should Sansa protect Jon? From what?

blog.name: arcalici
blog.title: Mother Of Mayhem

blog.description:
Im a proud black woman. Brooklyn Nine-Nine, Peaky Blinders, Animal Kingdom, Game of Thrones and Queen Beyonce.

I write Isaiah Jesus

I do Headcanons. Inbox open.

Spoiler Free Zone!

MASTERLIST

summary: They’re amazing books and blow the show completely out of the water it can’t even compete, but they are very long. Also Sansa...
question: They’re amazing books and blow the show completely out of the water it can’t even compete, but they are very long. Also Sansa and her friend used to call Arya horse face and pick on her a lot and her mother and Septa Mordane didn’t like how she acted so I think it’s given her low self esteem and in the book she often wonders if her mother will want her or not if she can make it back to them and she often thinks of going to Jon instead because in the books they’re very close.
answer:
Ahh. Thanks. I’ll watch the show. I think I’ll start after the show ends so I dont compare the books to the show. I did that with Harry Potter, and the last two movies were a huge disapointment cause I had finished the books before they came out.


I appreciate the insight. And explanation. What is your favorite book?
